I was brought up differently, to love the stranger as myself. We will conquer hate with love.

I have just returned from the southern border where Donald Trump’s web of policies to keep immigrants of color from entering our country was on full display. His immigration policies and hostility to my powerful sisters in Congress are all of a piece. Stir up hatred of the other.
Telling Congresswomen of color to go “home,” as if this is not their home, as if they’re not fully American, is nothing more than naked racism.

Wow, very moving. We assembled and served hundreds of hot dogs, chili, salad and other food to migrants near the bridge. Intrepid local volunteers brought the grub. So many women, men and children wondering whether they will be safe tonight and what is next for them. pic.twitter.com/i16tLDEyAt
Now we’re walking back across the bridge into Mexico to feed migrants seeking asylum and hearing more of their stories.

It’s easy enough for Members of Congress to walk back and forth, but for migrants seeking asylum the bridge must feel like an apparition, or a cruel joke. Imagine getting right there, but having little to no hope of crossing. pic.twitter.com/LMONJCiVid

The Mexican government keeps a list but it’s hundreds and hundreds of names long. It’s not clear whether people jump the line through corruption. In any event, the people said not one person has been taken off the list and admitted to seek asylum since last Sunday - a whole week.

We just walked across the border to Mexico and interviewed families waiting their turn to seek asylum. People were from Honduras, Guatemala, El Salvador Venezuela and perhaps other countries. The US refuses to keep a list, or to let people in in any significant numbers.

There’s something very wrong going on at our southern border. People are being kept in jail cells, chain link fenced pens and tents. Some have been in one cell for 60 days. Way too many people to sleep properly. Lights never off. Inadequate showers. pic.twitter.com/rtgPZms3kk
At Ursula we saw hundreds of unaccompanied minors, more boys but also girls, fathers with children, mothers with children. Lots of men in cells, too.
They’re just now getting in portable shower facilities. Up until now, they’ve been taking 13 men a day (sic) to county sheriff lock-ups to take showers, according to a commanding officer.

Just toured the holding facility here. Can’t post videos or photos yet, but conditions are very difficult, indeed. People held in massively overcrowded cells for up to 60 days. Little access to showers or laundry. Over 600 single adults are being held here.
Well, here we go. Preparing to drive to the McAllen Border Patrol Station and Centralized Processing Center with about 20 Members of Congress. I have confidence in our group to try to find the truth.
Just landed in Houston and rushing to a second flight to McAllen, TX so I can see for myself the conditions at the border. I’m deeply concerned about the care and human rights of migrants.

President Trump must remove Mr. Acosta from his position immediately. A person with this record of disregard for the rights and dignity of girls and trafficked persons has no place leading the department charged with protecting America’s working people.

Incredibly, Mr. Acosta proposed cutting the relevant portion of the International Labor Affairs Bureau (ILAB) by 79% in the 2020 budget, virtually eliminating his department’s efforts to combat human trafficking around the world.
Mr. Acosta not only failed miserably in his duties in this case, but he has continued to fail to comprehend the seriousness of sex and other human trafficking as Secretary of Labor.

Victims should never be left in the dark as they were by Mr. Acosta. What seems clear is not only that he got away with raping children, but that his non-prosecution let him continue his crimes after his white glove "punishment."

Simply stated, non-prosecution agreements are almost never offered for the kinds of crimes Epstein was alleged to have committed, for the seriousness of his case, for the breadth of his wrongdoing, and for the strength of the evidence available.
Multiple prosecutors from a variety of backgrounds have pointed out how far from the norm the deal Acosta gave Epstein was.

I am deeply alarmed by the role Secretary of Labor Alex #Acosta played when he was U.S. Attorney in allowing Jeffrey Epstein to avoid serious and appropriate consequences for the horrifying child sex trafficking he engaged in over a period of years.
